Category.Word: This is the title of this announcement, and this will be used to reference this announcement in your community.
This is the forum that this announcement will be displayed it. Select "All Forums" for this announcement to be displayed in all forums.
This announcement will not be displayed on your community until this date.
This announcement will only be displayed to your community until this date.
If this is disabled, BB Code will not be parsed.
If this is disabled, emoticons will not be displayed.
If this is enabled, HTML will be parsed.
If this is enabled, this announcement will also be displayed in all sub-forums of the selected forum in your community. This option is not applicable if this is a global announcement (all forums).
This is the actual extension that will be paired up with the given mime type(s) below (do not include the '.').
This is the maximum filesize of an attachment of this type that can be uploaded. Set to 0 to not have a limit.
This is the maximum height dimension of this given attachment. Only applicable to attachments uploaded as images.
This is the maximum width dimension of this given attachment. Only applicable to attachments uploaded as images.
If this is set to "No", then it will be as if this attachment extension does not exist. Nobody will be permitted to upload an attachment matching the given extension and mime type.

This is the mime type of this extension. For example, the mime type of a plain text document is "text/plain". You can associate multiple mime types for the specified attachment extension by separating each mime type by a carriage return (hit enter after each mime type).

This option allows you to chose where the attachments uploaded on your bulletin board are stored. It is generally recommended to store attachments in the file system (as the number of attachments grows, the overhead in database stored attachments grows, and thusly perforamce decreases). It may be useful to store attachments in the database for security reasons, if you're moving your community to another account, or possibly because you have a small community and/or a small number of attachments. Selecting "Yes" he will store all attachments in the file system, and selecting "No" will store all attachments in the database. Note: this will move all current attachments over to the selected medium.
Attachments are currently stored in the File System.
Attachments are currently stored in the database.
Deleting this avatar group will also delete all avatars belonging to this group from the database. The avatar images however, will remain in their current location.
This is the local path in which wtcBB will look for avatars. You will be displayed a listing of avatars in this directory, except for avatars already added in the database.

This screen will show you all images contained inside the directory path you entered (except for avatars already in the database). You can chose to not add an image as an avatar by unticking the checkbox to the left of each image. If an avatar name is omitted, that avatar will also not be added- even if it is ticked.
This is the group that the following added avatars will belong to. Groups can be used to organize different avatar sets, and they can also be hidden from desired usergroups.
This is the name of the avatar and how it will be referenced. (This will also be the alt text, which is what appears when an image cannot be displayed or when you hover over an image.)
You can specify a local file path to your desired avatar here.
OR you may upload an avatar from your computer here. Please make sure that the images/avatars folder is chmodded to 0777 on *nix systems.
This is the order in which this avatar will be displayed in relation to it's category.
This grouping feature will enable you to organize your avatars for better usability on your user's behalf. Also, groups can be hidden from desired usergroups.
This is simply the name of this BB Code. This is only used to reference the BB Code (ie: if this is displayed in the message area, this name is what will be written to signify this BB Code).
This is the tag name (don't include the "[" and "]"). This will be used as "[tag name]" in the message area.

This is the actual HTML code used to replace the above BB Code tag in messages. {param} represents the text between the BB Code: [tag]this is the param text[/tag]. And {option} represents the text used in this: [tag=option text]this is still the param text[/tag]. Basically, if you use "{option}" in your replacement, then your BB Code will look like "[bbcode=option]", otherwise it will look like "[bbcode]."
The example should include the intended usage of this BB Code. This example will only be viewable via the admin panel and is for referencing by users with administrative privileges only.

The description is simply a way for you to enter some text that will describe the usage of this BB Code. Like the example field, this is optional and is only displayed to users with administrative privileges in the control panel.
This will enable the usage of {option} in your replacement code. If this option is enabled, this BB Code should be written as: [tag=this is the option text]param text[/tag].

If this is enabled a button representing this BB Code will be displayed in the toolbar which is displayed in all message editing interfaces. If this is disabled, this BB Code will still be able to be used.
This will allow you to test out the BB Code you have added via the BB Code Manager. You can enter text here with BB Code just like you would in a post.
This is the title of this cron, of which it will be referred to as.
This is the filename of the file you wish for wtcBB to run. Please make sure that this is a path and not a URL.
If this is enabled, every time this cron is ran the date, time, and results of the cron will be logged.

Please select the week day in which this cron will run. Select the "*" for this cron to ignore the weekday option. Please note that a week day will automatically override the day of the month. Thusly, when the day of the week is set, the day of the month option is completely ignored.
Please select the day of the month in which this cron will run. Select the "*" for this cron to ignore the day of the month option.
Please select the hour in which this cron will run. Select the "*" for this cron to ignore the hour option.
Please select the minute in which this cron will run. Select the "*" for this cron to ignore the minute option.
Bans were lifted from the following users:
The following users' usergroups were changed:

This is the variable name of this FAQ entry, and will never actually be displayed to your users. This is used soley to correlate this FAQ entry with those in the language system. (For standards purposes, you should prefix all variable names for FAQ entries with "faq_".)
This is the display order relative to it's siblings (other FAQ entries with the same parent entry).
This is the parent FAQ entry of this entry. This serves as a way to organize your FAQ entries.
This is the title of this FAQ entry for this language. End users will see this.
This is the actual content of this FAQ entry for this language.
This is the name of the forum, and how it will be referenced to throughout your community.
This is the description for this forum, and will be displayed underneathe the forum name on the forum list.

This field allows you to control where this forum is placed on the forum list. Note: This is not the global display order of all forums, this number is relative to other forums on the same level of this forum with the same parent forum.

This is the cut off (in days) for threads listed in the forum. Any threads older than the specified amount of days will not be shown by default. This setting will not override a user's setting, but only the default setting set in wtcBB Options.
You can set the parent forum for this forum here. If you want to make this forum a top-level forum, simply select "No Parent Forum".
This is the password that will be required to gain entry to this forum. All users will be prompted for a password. If you do not want to password protect this forum, leave this field empty.

If you would like for this forum to become a link, enter the URL here. Leave this field empty for the forum to retain normal behavior. (Note: When a forum becomes a link, no posts can be made or viewed, and when it is attempted to be viewed the viewer will be redirected to this link.)
If you would like to set a default style for this forum that is different from your global default style, you may set it here. Select "Use Forum Default" for this option to have no effect.
If this is enabled, the style selected above (if it isn't "Use Forum Default") will be forced upon the user, no matter what setting the user has.

If this is set to yes, this forum will become a category. Generally categories are used to group other forums together. A category cannot directly contain posts, nor can any posts existing in a category be viewed.
If this is disabled, this forum will simply not be displayed. It will be like this forum has been deleted.
If this is disabled, the forum and the threads & posts contained inside of it will still be viewable. However, no new posts or threads will be accepted.
If this is disabled, posts made in this forum will not be added to a user's post count.
If this is disabled, this forum will not be listed on the forum jump selection menu at the bottom of each page (if the forum jump is enabled).
Please enter the username of the user you would like to grant access/block from forums.

Please note that this is the ultimate override. If you have a specific forum set to "No", that user account will not be able to view that forum no matter what. The opposite goes if a specific forum is set to "Yes". If a forum is set to "Inherit", then the access level for that forum will be ignored (this is the default action). Unless overridden, child forums will inherit their parent forums setting.
This is the username of the user you wish to make a moderator.
You can select which forum(s) you wish this moderator to have moderator privileges in.

This option is useful if you are promoting a "Registered User" to a "Moderator." With this option, you can automatically move this user to the "Moderators" usergroup, and make this user a moderator in one step.
If this is disabled, this moderator will only moderate the forum you assign, and his/her privileges will not automatically inherit to sub-forums.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be permitted to edit posts in this forum.
If this is disabled, moderators will not be permitted to edit threads in this forum. Editing threads entales changing the thread title, the post icons, and leaving notes.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to edit polls in this forum. Editing a poll grants permission to change the vote choices, who voted, and the vote counts.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to delete posts or threads in this forum.

If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to permanently delete posts and threads from this forum. Permanently deleting translates into completely wiping it from the database. Whereas regular deleting simply hides it from users who don't have rights ('View Deletion Notices') to see it.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to open or close threads in this forum.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to move threads from this forum into another one.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to merge two threads into one in this forum.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to split one thread into two in this forum.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able view users' IP addresses in this forum.
If this is disabled, this moderator will be denied access to the Moderator Control Panel.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to add/edit/delete announcements for this forum only.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to mass move threads from this forum to another one.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to mass delete posts or threads in this forum.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able to view a users full profile in the control panel.

If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to ban users from the moderator control panel. (Note: This is not referring to banishment from the community as a whole, but rather, banishment from the forum that this moderator has been granted privileges to.)
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to restore users to be able to view this forum.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to edit user signatures from the control panel.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to change user avatars.
If this is enabled, this moderator will receive an email notification every time a post is made in this forum.
If this is enabled, this moderator will receive an email notification for every new thread created in this forum.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to "Approve" or "Disapprove" any threads made by users whose threads require supervision before they are posted.
If this is enabled, this moderator will be able to "Approve" or "Disapprove" any posts made by users whose posts require supervision before they are posted.
If this is disabled, this moderator will not be able stick threads in their forum.
Blue - Has custom permissions that have been inherited.
This is the usergroup that the following permissions will be applied to.

This is the forum that the below permissions will be applied to. <strong>Remember, permissions are inherited to child forums. It's much more managable to add permissions to a parent forum, and let them inherit to their child forums, instead of creating custom permissions for each child forum.
If this is disabled, users will not be able to see the forum at all (it will appear as though it doesn't exist).
There Was an Error in Your Request
Thank you for your request. Your information has been processed.
Click Here If You Are Not Redirected
Are you sure you want to perform this action?
Are you sure you want to delete?

If you choose to download, you will be able to save the XML (a type of file, in which information can be transported) file to your computer. If you choose not to download, then the XML file will automatically be stored in the exports directory, located inside the root folder of your wtcBB installation.
This is the name of the group and this is also how this group will be referenced throughout your bulletin board.

These are the usergroups that are allowed to use the smilies contained in this group. Please note that only people in the selected usergroup(s) will be able to use it and see it. Therefore, it will look like plain text to users outside of the selected usergroups. Select all usergroups to have this group shown to everybody.
This is the parent group. This provides a way to neatly organize templates in a fashion that makes the system as a whole more extensible and easier to navigate.
This is the order position in which this group will be listed.
Deleting this language group will also delete all language words belonging to this group from the database.
This is the title of the language category. This is for structural and sorting purposes.
Select the language set that this category will belong to.
This is the parent category of this category. You may make this a top level category by selecting "No Parent".
This is the display name of these words. This is for structural purposes only.
This is the variable name of these words. This variable name is used to access these words via the scripting backend. Make sure you use good naming conventions.
This is the language group that these words will belong to.
This is the category that these words will belong too. This is for structural purposes only.
This is where you may enter the words to be used.
You may enter the name of the new language you want to add here.

You may export a certain set of words by selecting their category here. You may export all words by selecting "Whole Language." It will also include their child categories as well. You may select multiple categories by holding down the "ctrl" button on your keyboard, and clicking on the desired categories. Note: You cannot select only sub-categories, as it is not a gurantee that wherever this data is imported, that there will be a parent category with a correct ID.
Please select the language that you would like to export from.
File Path to XML File: OR...
You may enter the file path of the language XML file you would like to import. Please note that this is not a URL, it is a file path. You may also upload an XML below.
You may upload any XML file on your computer with this field

You may select to create a new language set with the given XML file. You can also overwrite an existing language set (only words and categories in the XML file that match up with words and categories in the selected language set will be overwritten). If you chose to overwrite, I highly suggest you take a current backup (if you've made any changes) to the language set you're overwriting, so you can restore it if things go awry.
If you have chosen "Create New Language" in the above option, you may enter the name of the new language set here.
File Path to XML File: OR...
You may enter the file path of the style XML file you would like to import. Please note that this is not a URL, it is a file path. You may also upload an XML below.
If you enter text here, it will replace the style name already contained in the XML file.
You may upload any XML file on your computer with this field
This will allow you to chose where this will search with the query given below.
You may enter here what you want to search for.
Please chose the language set you would like to search.
This is the number of log entries that will be shown per page. Be careful not to set this too high, as the larger this number is the longer it will take to load.
This allows you to sort your logs for easier viewing.
You can select a date cut off in which entries will be pruned.
Only Show Log Entries Made By:
You may narrow your log viewing down to a specific user by selecting the user here.
Only Show Log Entries For This Script:
You can narrow down your log viewing by opting to view log entries generated by a specific script.
You can narrow your log entry viewing to any given cron script.
You may narrow down the entries you view to which type of moderator action.
This will reset all user post counts to that of the actual number of posts in the database.
This will update all forum information, such as the last reply fields as well as post and thread counts.
This will reset all usernames stored to match current usernames. For example, this will update thread and post usernames, as well as usernames that appear in the "last reply" fields.
This will update all thread information, such as reply counts and last reply data.
Please enter the local path to the directory containing post icons you would like to add. (Note: post icons that are already in the database will not appear.)

This screen will show you all images contained inside the directory path you entered (except for post icons already in the database). You can chose to not add an image as a post icon by omitting the "Post Icon Name" field or by unticking the checkbox to the left of any image.
This is the name of the post icon and how it will be referenced (ie: if you hover over a post icon, you will see this name).
This is the local file path location of the desired image for this post icon. You may also upload a post icon from your computer using the option below.
OR you may upload a post icon here. This will put the image you upload in the images/icons directory. Make sure that the directory is chmodded to 0777 on *nix operating systems.
This is the order in which this post icon will be displayed.
This is the name of the field, and will be displayed to the user.
This is the description of the field, and will be shown underneathe the field name to the user.

This option governs how the user modifies this data. They can either enter their own free-form text, select one choice using a drop down menu or a set of radio buttons, or select many choices using a multi-select menu or a set of checkboxes.

The default value for a field is the text that will automatically be displayed, or the choice that will already be selected. (If you are using a multi-select/checkbox option, you can separate multi-selected default items with a new line.) If you are using anything but a normal text box or a textarea, please make sure the default value text matches exactly the items you want selected, or else they will not be selected.

If you have selected anything but "text" for the field type, then please list all of the different options you want for this field (they will be shown in select menus, multi-select menus, checkboxes, or radio buttons). Please put each item on its own line.
Each profile field must be categorized. The profile field will be displayed inside a box labeled as the category selected here (along with other profile fields in the category).
Profile fields can be displayed in whichever order you chose.
This is the path to the image that will be used to repeat the specified number of times below.
This is the number of times that the image will be repeated.
This will allow you to chose specifically which usergroup will have these ranks displayed. Select "All Usergroups" for these ranks to be displayed for everyone.

You may also upload an image from your computer by clicking the "Browse" button and finding the image on your local computer. <strong>In order for this upload feature to work, the "ranks" folder inside the "images" folder must have writeable access (usually a chmod to "0777" will work).

This is the rank that will appear near a user's username when posting if the minimum post requirement set below is met. HTML is allowed. (If you want to repeat an image a certain amount of times based on someone's post count, use "User Images".)
If a user meets this minimum post requirement, the above rank will be assigned to this user.
Deleting this smiley group will also delete all smilies belonging to this group from the database. The smiley images however, will remain in their current location.
Please enter the local path to the directory containing smilies you would like to add. (Note: smilies that are already added in the database will not appear.)

This screen will show you all images contained inside the directory path you entered (except for smilies already in the database). You can chose to not add an image as a smiley by omitting either the "Smiley Name" or "Replacement" fields, or by unticking the checkbox to the left of any image.
This is the group that the following added smilies will belong to. Groups can be used to organized differing smiley sets, and they can also be hidden from desired usergroups.
This is the name of the smiley and is how it will be referenced.
This is the local file path location of the desired image for this smiley. You may also upload a smiley from your computer using the option below.
OR you may upload a smiley here. This will put the image you upload in the images/smilies directory. Make sure that the directory is chmodded to 0777 on *nix operating systems.
This is what will be used in plain text to represent this smiley. If smilies are enabled in the context of posting, this replacement text will be replaced with the actual smiley.
This is the order that this smiley will be displayed, relative to its group.
This is the group that this smiley will belong to. Groups can be used to organized differing smiley sets, and they can also be hidden from desired usergroups.
Are you sure you want to delete this style template group? All templates existing in this group (and child-groups) will be moved all into the "Custom Templates" group.
This is the name of this style, and this is how it will be referenced throughout wtcBB.

This is the parent style of this style. This new style will inherit all template modifications, color changes, and replacement variables from the specified parent style. You may also opt to have no parent and start out fresh.
This is the display order of this style relating to it's direct siblings. This will control the order in which this style is presented in any given list of styles.

If this is enabled, then this style will be able to be selected for use via the User Control Panel (granted that the user has access to change styles). Keep in mind, that even if this style isn't selectable it can still be accessed via the "styleid" variable in any URL on the bulletin board.

This is different from the above option in that this completely disables this style from viewing by anyone other than Administrators (specified in usergroup settings). Disabled styles will not be listed nor will they be accessible via the "styleid" variable in a URL by anyone other than Administrators.
Note: You may browse between tabs without losing previously entered data.

Note: These CSS declarations are placed inside the main selector group for this portion of the style. This means that if you incorporate curly braces ("{" and "}") into the code below, you may receive unexpected results. This is for advanced users only.

Note: This field is for all advanced CSS declarations you wish to manually add to your stylesheet. They will look like ".myextraclass { color: white; }"
Only use this field if you know CSS well.

This page allows you to modify the names of images that you otherwise would need to edit templates to do. It provides one central location for the management of image names used in templates. Note: Images listed here are for styles only (found in your style images folder, not in folders such as "message" and "ranks"). If you cannot find your image here it's either because it isn't a style image, or it can be found in the "Visual Settings" or "Colors & Style Options" sections of managing a style.
Sorry, but no replacement variables exist. Add a Replacement Variable.

Replacement variables are a way to automatically find and replace text throughout your community. These replacement variables affect all user text. That means posts, thread titles, personal messages, etc. Replacement variables are not applied to templates or any areas of the administration panel. Remember, the text will only be replaced for users using the appropriate style.
This is the style to search. Only results from this style will be shown (including custom and inherited templates).
This query will be searched in template titles and content.

This is the name of the template and how it will be referenced throughout the style system and also how it will be accessed in the PHP code. It is usually best to prefix the name of the template with consistency of the rest of the templates (as in, specifying the parent group names delimited by underscores before the template name itself). This however is not required, but is simply suggested as a best practice.

This is the style that this template will belong too. Remember, this style will be inherited into any child styles of the style that is selected here. Inherited templates override the standard default templates, but can also be overrided by editing the template itself in that style, or editing the same template further down the tree.

This is the template group that this template will belong to. Template groups are for organizational purposes only. They serve as no extra functionality to the bulletin board, but rather a convenience when keeping hundreds of templates organized so they are easy to find.
Selecting a date here will only move threads that have a last reply made after this date.
Selecting a date here will only move threads that have a last reply made before this date.
Entering a username here will constain only threads made by this user to be moved.
Only threads in this forum will be moved. You can select "All Forums" if you do not want it to be forum specific.
This is the forum in which threads will be moved to.
Selecting a date here will only prune posts that were made after this date.
Selecting a date here will only prune posts that were made before this date.
Entering a username here will constain only posts made by this user to be pruned.
Only posts in this forum will be pruned. You can select "All Forums" if you do not want it to be forum specific.
Selecting a date here will only prune threads that have a last reply made after this date.
Selecting a date here will only prune threads that have a last reply made before this date.
Entering a username here will constain only threads made by this user to be pruned.
Only threads in this forum will be pruned. You can select "All Forums" if you do not want it to be forum specific.
This is the title of this usergroup, and is how it will be referred to throughout the message board.
Used as a reminder of the responsibility/purpose this usergroup serves.
This is the title that will appear beside a user's username, which allows anyone to identify which group a user belongs to.
This is the HTML that will come before a user's username when displayed on the message board. This can be overridden on a per user basis by administrators only.
This is the HTML that will come after a user's username when displayed on the message board. This can be overridden on a per user basis by administrators only.
If this is enabled, users of this group will have administrative privileges and access to the Administrator Control Panel.
If this is enabled users of this group will be Global Moderators. Global Moderators have the same permissions as regular moderators, except they automatically have those permissions for all forums.

Making a group a "Banned Usergroup" will simply put this on the list of "Banned Usergroups" (ie: when you're banning a user, you have a choice of which banned usergroup to ban the user to). In effect, this is simply a label, unlike the above two options.
If this is enabled, members of this usergroup will be listed on the "Listed Usergroups" page (linked to from the Forum Home page).
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be shown on the member's list.
If this is enabled, members' birthdays in this usergroup will be shown on the bottom of the Forum Home page (if the birthdays box is enabled).
Disabling this will completely deny access to the whole message board.

If this is disabled, users of this group will not be able to view any forums. This is useful for message boards that disallow all content to guests, yet want them to be able to register. (Using the above option, will block the whole message board, including the registration page. This will only block the forums.)
If this is disabled, members of this group will be disallowed from using any of the search functions on the message board.
If this option is enabled, members of this group will be allowed to view users that have specified themselves as invisible in the "Currently Active Users" boxes.
If this is disabled, this user will only be allowed to view their own profile.
If this is disabled, members of this group will be disallowed access from viewing the member's list.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to view threads made by other users.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to view threads made by themselves.

If this is enabled, members of this group will be granted access to see all deletion notices (if posts are deleted, but not permanently deleted, there will be a notification that replaces that post and would normally be hidden to all users, to give the effect that it actually was deleted).
If this is enabled, a small notification will be displayed at the bottom of a post if it was edited, and will supply the date, time, and the user who edited the post.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to make themselves invisible in the "Currently Active Users" boxes.
This will allow members of this group to show or hide the "Edited By" notice on a per post basis.
This will allow members of this group to change their user title.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to specify a default font, color, and size for messages that they post.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to post new threads.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to reply to threads made by other users.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to reply to their own threads.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to edit their own posts.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to edit the title of threads they have made.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be allowed to delete their own posts.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to permanently delete their posts from the database.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to delete their own threads.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to permanently delete their threads from the database.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to close their own threads.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to edit their profile.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be allowed to disable the forum wide censor for messages.

If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to create an ignore list. Members of their ignore list will not be able to PM or email them, and by default their posts will be hidden from members that chose to ignore him/her.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to switch styles.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be allowed to have a signature.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to send a receipt with their message. This will allow them to track which messages have been read or not by the recipient.

If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to deny a receipt request. In effect, members of this group can read a message but make it appear as though they didn't read it in the eyes of the sender.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to add, edit, and delete folders in order to keep a more organized inbox.
This is the maximum amount of messages members of this group will be able to store in their inbox. Enter 0 here if you want to disable personal messaging entirely for members of this group.
This is the maximum amount of recipients members of this group can send one message to at a time. Don't set this too high, as it can be quite costly in resources.

This is the maximum amount of message rules members of this group can have at any one time. Message rules allow users to move (to a different folder) or delete incoming messages based upon the user sending them, or the usergroup that the user is in. This can also be costly in resources if set too high. Set this to 0 if you want message rules disabled entirely for members of this group.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to issue warning points to other members.
If this is enabled, members of this group cannot be issued warnings.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to view their own warning level.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to view warning levels of other members.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be allowed to have an avatar. Avatars are images displayed in each user's post, which are usually used as a symbol of identification.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to upload avatars from their computer onto your server.
This is the maximum file size an uploaded avatar can be, in bytes.
This is the maximum width for uploaded avatars, in pixels.
This is the maximum height for uploaded avatars, in pixels.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to upload attachments in messages.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be allowed to download attachments.

This is the maximum file size that any attachment uploaded by this user can be, in bytes. There are already max file size restrictions for each extension uploaded, however if you want to implicity set a file size cap for this usergroup, set it here. Set this to 0 if you do not want to set an implicit cap.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subject to the flood check.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subjected to the minimum characters in post restriction.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subject to the maximum amount of characters restriction.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subject the maximum amount of images in a message restriction.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subject to the minimum amount of characters in a search query restriction.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subject to the maximum amount of characters in a search query restriction.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to see the "Who's Online" page. However, they will be able to still see "Currently Active Users" boxes.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to view detailed locations of each user. This may include thread names in forums that this user does not have access to.
If this is enabled, members of this group will be able to view users' IP addresses on the "Who's Online" page. Note: This will also display the User Agent string.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be allowed to create polls.
If this is disabled, members of this group will not be able to vote on polls.

If this is enabled, posts made by users of this group will be entered into a que (of which, moderators with access and administrators will be able to access). While posts are in this que, they will not be displayed on the message board. They will stay in the que until someone with access approves the post (it shows in the forum), or disapproves of the post (the post is deleted).

If this is enabled, threads made by users of this group will be entered into a que (of which, moderators with access and administrators will be able to access). While threads are in this que, they will not be displayed on the message board. They will stay in the que until someone with access approves the thread (it shows in the forum), or disapproves of the thread (the thread is deleted from the database).
This is the maximum amount of attachments any user in this usergroup can upload.
If this is enabled, members of this group will not be subject to the maximum amount of characters in a signature restriction.
If this is disabled, user rank images will not show for this usergroup.
This is the group that you apply this automation to. Only users in the usergroup selected and fit the criteria specified below will be automatically set into a new usergroup.
Please select the usergroup that you would like to move (or add) this user to.

If this is ticked as "Yes", the users will be added as secondary users to the usergroups chosen below. If this is ticked as "No", this user's primary usergroup will be changed to the usergroup selected below.

This is the cut off point for posts a user has. Either the user can have greater than or equal to, or less than this amount, and depending upon the option below, only users meeting this criteria will be automated.
This is the cut off for how many days the user has to be registered for. The same concept for posts applies to this.
The post cut off can either be "Greater Than or Equal To" the above value, or "Less Than" the above value.
The registration day cut off can either be "Greater Than or Equal To" the above value, or "Less Than" the above value.
This is how the posts and number of days registered values will be handled.

Usergroup Automation allows you to automatically assign users to different groups based off of a certain set of criteria (namely, how many posts a user has and how many days a user has been registered). Every day, using wtcBB's Cron System, wtcBB will search for users meeting the following criteria and either change their primary usergroup, or add them to secondary usergroups (depending on which you pick below).
This is the username by which a user will be referenced by the bulletin board system.
This is the password that this user will need to know in order to login to their account and post. Passwords are hashed before they enter the database.
This is the email address by which this user is to receive administrative, subscription, and notification emails.

This is the primary usergroup in which this user will belong. Remember, if a permission is enabled in any of the usergroups a user is in (including secondary), that "Yes" takes precedence (even if 4 out of the 5 usergroups a user is in has that permission disabled).
This is the user's user title. And will appear under the user's username (in the default postbit template).

You can control whether or not to force this user title to override this user's usergroup's title, or a default user title assigned by post count (controlled in the "User Titles" section of the admin control panel). Selecting "Inherit User Title" will then use this user's usergroup's user title, and if the usergroup does not have a title designated, then it will revert to a title assigned by post count. If you select one of the "Force User Title" options, this will force the user title entered here.
This is the HTML that will come before a user's username when displayed on the message board. This will override username markup specified by the usergroup that this user belongs to.
This is the HTML that will come after a user's username when displayed on the message board. This will override username markup specified by the usergroup that this user belongs to.

This is the parent/guardian's email address for this user. All email sent to this user, will also be sent to this user's parent. This email address is also used to verify a parent's permission for children under the age of 13, in order to register.

When a user is designated as a "COPPA User," the respecting user will be unable to post, receive emails, and their profiles will be blocked from other members. When a COPPA user registers, this option will be enabled until a parent verifies their registration. This has nothing to do with the "COPPA Usergroup."

This is the warning level of the user. It is highly recommended that you do not change the warning level here, as it will not reflect in the warning system logs, and thus the warning level will either be more or less than it should be.
This will enable Daylight Savings Time for this user. (Pushes all times forward one hour.)
Select the time zone that this user is in. The current time in each time zone is listed next to it.
This is the join date of this user. You may override it.
You may alter this user's date and time of their last visit to the forum.
You may alter this user's date and time of their last activity to the forum.
You may alter this user's date and time of their last post on the forum.
This is the most recently logged IP address this user logged in under.
This is the username of the user who referred this user to your community.
This is the number of users this user has referred to your community.
A user's signature consists of text and/or images, of which will appear below each post.
This is the default font that messages posted by this user will appear in, if this feature is enabled by both the administrator and the user.
This is the default color of text that messages posted by this user will appear in, if this feature is enabled by both the administrator and the user.
This is the default font size that messages posted by this user will appear in, if this feature is enabled by both the administrator and the user.

This will enable a javascript toolbar when this user is posting a message on the bulletin board. The toolbar consists of quick and easy access to BB Code (allows you to format text in messages, without HTML), so you don't have to memorize it. If this user doesn't have javascript enabled, or doesn't use a javascript enabled browser, it is recommended that this option be disabled.
This controls the order in which posts are displayed for this user in any given thread. The conventional order is "Oldest First."

This will allow this user to use HTML anywhere on the message board (including signatures, posts, personal messages, etc). Be very careful with this option, as it will override all other options (if enabled), users can do very serious damage if HTML is allowed.
This will completely disallow this user from having a signature. This will override any other setting (if enabled).
If this option is disabled, this user will not be able to view any signatures of any other users, including their own.
If this option is disabled, this user will not be able to view any other users' avatars, including their own.
If this options is disabled, this user will not be able to see any images implemented in a message using the [img] BB Code.
If this is disabled, this user will not be able to download or view any attachments posted by themselves or other users. They will still be allowed to upload attachments, however.
If this is disabled, users will not be able to see any emoticons in any messages, including their own.

When a user is "invisible," no user except for administrators and global moderators will be able to see them in the "Who's Online" box, of if they are browsing a specific forum or thread. The user will be able to surf the forum as a ghost to all but global moderators and administrators.
If this is disabled, this user will not receive any (mass) emails sent by the administrator. They may however, receive emails from users via the message board.
Can Be Contacted By Other Users:
If this is disabled, no user will be able to send this user an email. This user may however, still receive administrative (mass) emails.
If this is disabled, this user will not be able to receive personal messages. If a user attempts to send a personal message to this user, it will bounce back and will never reach it's destination.
Receive New Personal Message Email Notification:
If this is disabled, a user will not receive an email notification alerting them of a new incoming personal message.
Receive Popup Alert When New Personal Messages Arrive:
If this is enabled, users will receive a javascript popup alert notifying them of a new incoming personal message.
This is the number of posts that will be displayed on each page in any given thread.
You may select a style different from the default for this user to use. They will see this style wherever they go on the message board, unless it is overridden in one of the forums.
Only threads conforming to this time frame will be displayed in the thread list, unless overridden by a specific forum.

The option to use it when posting and sending personal messages will simply automatically be checked. You can uncheck it to not use the default BB Code. If this is set to off, you can also always check it to use it occasionally.
This will completely disable the forum censor (specified in the 'Censorship' options, under the 'wtcBB Options' menu) for this user.

You may select multiple secondary usergroups for this user. Secondary usergroups are useful when you want to tack on extra rights (or remove rights) to a specific set of users, while still maintaining the main usergroup base.
This is the language that will be used for this user. Select "Use Forum Default" for this user to use the language specified as the default language in the "Setup" area of "wtcBB Options".
This is the user's avatar. As an adminstrator, you can specify any image here.
Enter the username of the user you would like to ban.
Please select the usergroup you would like to ban this user to.
Please select the type of banishment for this user (either permanent, which can be undone manually, or temporary).

If you change the "Type of Banishment" option (which is in effect changing how long the user is banned), then the ban timer will reset, and the user will serve another term of banishment. If the type of banishment is left the same, then the banishment term will continue and will not restart.
If this is enabled, this will only show you the results of the mass email, but will not actually send the email to the users.

This is the content of the email that will be sent to the users meeting the below criteria.

You may also use certain variables to personalize each email:

$userid - Shows the userid
$username - Shows the username
$email - Shows the user's email address
This is the subject of each email sent.
This is the email address used to show who has sent the email.
Number of Emails to Send at Once:
This is the number of emails that will be sent in each batch. This will help prevent from mail overflow.
Go Back to Mass Email Search Page
This is the user that will stay in tact, and all information from the specified account above will be transferred into this one.
This is the account that will be merged into the one specified below. After all information is merged, this account will be deleted.
This field will limit the results to users who have posts less than this amount. Specify 0 here if you want the search to ignore post counts.

Selecting a usergroup will filter the result set to users who have their primary usergroup to set to the selected group. Selecting "All Usergroups" will instruct the search to ignore a user's usergroup when forming the result set.
This will filter out the results to users who have registered before the date specified. To have the search ignore this criteria, simply omitt either the year or day fields.
This will filter the result set to users who haven't logged on to your community in duration (in days) specified here. Leave as 0 for the search to ignore this.
Are you sure you want to move the selected users?

You cannot modify this users status via this method because of one of the following reasons:

- This user is an Administrator
- This user is a Global Moderator
- This user is a Moderator
- This user is protected by the $uneditableUsers variable in the config.php file
Search For Users By IP Address:
Enter a complete or partial IP Address here. A list of users will be shown that have logged on using the specified IP Address.
Search For IP Addresses By Username:
This will allow you to locate all IP Addresses that a user has logged in under.

This is the maximum width (in pixels) that any thumbnail can be. If an image is uploaded and is greater than this width, it will be resized proportionally (for the thumbnail only). Be careful not set this value too high, as it could heavily consume resources.

This is the maximum height (in pixels) that any thumbnail can be. If an image is uploaded and is greater than this height, it will be resized proportionally (for the thumbnail only). Be careful not set this value too high, as it could heavily consume resources.

If this is disabled, thumbnails will not be generated for images uploaded as attachments. Please note that GD 2.0.28 must be installed. If you do not know what this is, or do not know which version is installed, please contact your host or server administrator.

This will allow you to set a "Flood Check" sort of speak. It will take effect globally, and anyone trying to perform an action under the given amount of time, will be given an error. Actions include posting, personal messaging, emailing, etc.

Put the cookie timeout here, in which this is the amount of time a user must remain inactive before all posts are marked as read, and how long a user will stay in the "Who's Online" after their last activity.
This is the path in which cookies will be set. This is useful if you have multiple instances of wtcBB on one domain. Please remember to keep the trailing slash.

This is the domain in which cookies will be in effect. This is useful if you have multiple sub-domains running different instances of wtcBB. Remember to keep the preceeding dot. If you are running wtcBB on your localhost, leave the cookie domain field blank.

This is a security option only. If users are allowed to login with cookie disabled browsers, then they can only be logged in via a session ID carried through the URL. Because of this, sessions can be hijacked, and thus users can login as others. Although unlikely, this does open up the possibility of it happening.
This is the format in which the date will be presented on all wtcBB pages. It uses the PHP Date function format.
This is the format in which the time will be presented on all wtcBB pages. It uses the PHP Date function format.
This is the default time zone offset set for the message board. Members will be able to override this in their preferences.
This is the default DST (Daylight Savings Time) setting for the message board. Users will be able to override this in their preferences. Enabling this will push all times on the forum ahead one hour.
If this is enabled, dates that are "Today" or "Yesterday" will be labeled as such.

This is a global directive for toggling the viewing of Who's Online. If this is disabled, you will not be able to view it on the Forum Home page. This however does not stop users from viewing the Who's Online page (this is controlled via usergroups).
When disabled, the forum stats will not be displayed on the Forum Home page. You might disable this if you want you forum home page to load faster.
If this is disabled, then users without access to any particular forum will be able to see that it exists. However they will not be able to view the contents.
This is the amount of threads that will be listed on each page when viewing a forum.

When this option is enabled, a box will appear at the bottom of each forum that will display the users who are currently viewing that thread. Note: This can be quite server intensive if there are many simultaneous users.
This is the number of replies a thread can receive to be considered "hot." (Thread can be come hot through replies or views.)
This is the number of views a thread can receive to be considered "hot." (Thread can be come hot through replies or views.)

You can enter words to censor here. All user input is passed through a censorship function that will replace each character in a censored word with the character specified below. Please separate each word with a space.
Each character in a censored word will be replaced with this character (or characters).
Put the name of your message board here.
This is the administrative contact email address. It will be used to send board emails.
This text will be signed at the bottom of every board mailer.

This is the number of smilies displayed in the message interface. You might want to increase/decrease this number based on the average size of each smiley. Set this to 0 to disable the display of smilies in the message interface. There will still be a link to access all smilies.
This option will toggle the display of the thread review in the message interface. Disable this if you have a busy community and would like to reserve resources.

This will toggle the display of the toolbar in the message interface. Note that this is also a user configuration option, and if this is disabled the user will not be able to view the toolbar- regardless of their setting.
This is the minimum amount of characters required in any given message in order for it to be posted/sent.
This is the maximum amount of characters allowed in any given message for it to be posted/sent.
This is the maximum amount of images allowed in any given message in order for it to be posted/sent. This does include smilies.
This is the maximum amount of characters allowed in the subject/title of any message.
This is the minimum amount of characters allowed in the title/subject of any message.

This field will allow you to differentiate guests from robots browsing your message board. You should input here something that can be found in the robot's User Agent and is unique to that robot. Make you separate each robot with a new line.
This is the description matching the robots listed above. This name will be displayed wherever plausible. Remember to have the robots and their descriptions coordinated on the same line.

Selecting yes here will enable the forum jump on all pages, which will display a drop down menu with links to every forum. On boards with a large amount of forums, it could slow down performance due to the amount of HTML produced.

This is the default language used on the bulletin board. All guests will see this language, but users (if given the permission) will be able to override this, and select a different language if others are added.

When this is enabled, users will be presented with a redirect screen to confirm their request. If this is disabled, this screen will be omitted and the user will be redirected to the next screen immediately. When disabled it allows for faster surfing and less bandwidth usage.

This is the number of days that the forum/topic read indicators will stay in the database. Effectively, this option should negatively correlate with the traffic on your forum (the busier the forum, the less the read timeout should be).
If a user hasn't selected a style, or a guest is visiting, then this style will be used.

Word.name: admin_options_threadSettings_settablePostsPerPage_desc
Word.displayName: User Settable Posts Per Page Description

Category.Word: This will allow you to limit what users can set for how many posts are displayed per page inside of each thread. As the higher the number a user choses, the more resources are used. Separate each amount by a space.
This will allow you to set the default amount of posts shown per page in each thread. This will apply to guests, and users who have not changed this preference in their User Control Panel.

When this option is enabled, a box will appear at the bottom of each thread that will display the users who are currently viewing that thread. Note: This can be quite server intensive if there are many simultaneous users.
This is more of a security check in place to stop malscious users from sucking up too many resources.
This is the maximum number of poll options that can be added for any user.

When this option is enabled, users will be kept in the "Awaiting Activation" usergroup until they have verified their email address by clicking on a link in an automatically generated email sent by wtcBB.
When this is enabled, new registrants will be forced to enter a unique email address. When this is disabled, multiple user accounts will be permitted to have the same email address.
Disabling this option will disallow any new registrations from being made in your community.
Maximum Character Count for Custom Title:
This is the maximum amount of characters that can be entered in the custom title input field in the User Control Panel.
Minimum Character Count for Custom Title:
This is the minimum amount of characters that can be entered in the custom title input field in the User Control Panel.
This is the maximum amount of characters a user can have in their username when registering.
This is the minimum amount of characters a user can have in their username when registering.

It is required by law to get parental consent when collecting information from children under the age of 13. When this is enabled, wtcBB will collect a parent's email address, and send them the activation email instead of sending it to the user's email. If you do not have to conform to the COPPA regulations, then you may disable this and the user will not be asked for their birthday (making for a quicker registration).

See http://www.ftc.gov/bcp/conline/pubs/buspubs/coppa.htm for more details.
Users will not be able to use more characters than the limit specified here in their signature. Enter 0 here to not impose a limit.
Show Threads From the Last Day
Show Threads From the Last Two Days
Show Threads From the Last Week
Show Threads From the Last Two Weeks
Show Threads From the Last Month
Show Threads From the Last 45 Days
Show Threads From the Last Two Months
Show Threads From the Last 75 Days
Show Threads From the Last Three Months
Show Threads From the Last Six Months
Show Threads From the Last Year
This is not an official board mailer, and has been sent to you from another member through the forum mailing system.
If you do not wish to receive anymore emails, please login to your account and disable all appropriate email options.

Hello,
You have successfully registered for our community message board. We ask that you complete the final step of our registration process by clicking on the link below to validate your email address. (If you cannot click on the link below, then please copy and paste it into your address bar.)

Hello,
Congratulations! You have successfully completed the registration process to our community message board.

Hello,
A post has been reported. Details are listed below:

Hello,
This is a subscription notification for a forum or thread that you subscribed for. This means that there has been a new thread or reply made since the last time you visited. You may click on the link below to view the new thread/reply. (If you cannot click on the link below, then please copy and paste it to your address bar.)

Hello,
Your child has recently registered for our community message board. In order to allow your child to become a full and complete member, you must first verify their membership in compliance with the Child Online Privacy Protection Act by clicking the link below. (If you cannot click on the link below, please copy and paste it into your address bar.)

Hello,
In order to modify your password, you must first confirm that you want to change it. If you did not request that your password be changed, then simply do nothing as the ability to confirm this email only lasts for 24 hours. After 24 hours, any attempt to confirm your new password will be invalid.
In order to verify the password change, please click on the following link. (If you cannot click on the link below, then please copy and paste it into your address bar.)

Hello,
In order to modify your email address, you must first confirm that you want to change it. If you did not request that your email address be changed, then simply do nothing as the ability to confirm this email only lasts for 24 hours. After 24 hours, any attempt to confirm your new email address will be invalid.
In order to verify the email address change, please click on the following link. (If you cannot click on the link below, then please copy and paste it into your address bar.)
Sorry, but no user id or username were supplied. Information could not be gathered.
Sorry, but the specified user does not exist.
Sorry, but the provided usergroup ID is incorrect.
Sorry, but the requested usergroup does not exist.
Sorry, but the requested information does not exist.
Sorry, but you have made a call to a fragment that doesn't exist for this style.
Sorry, but you have followed an invalid link or are trying to view a page that doesn't exist.
Sorry, but no action was performed as nothing was selected. Please make a selection and try again.
Sorry, but the administrator has specified that you must wait before trying to send a message, or run a search again.
Sorry, the page you are trying to view does not exist.

If you were processing a request, and filled out a significant amount of data, you may press the "Back" button on your web browser, and attempt to regain information you had type in. If not, you may click the link below.
Sorry, but you cannot have duplicate variable names.
Sorry, there were no results found with the given information.
Sorry, you cannot delete a default word.
Sorry, but you must have at least one language installed in order for wtcBB to run correctly.
Sorry, but you must supply more information in order to complete your request.
Sorry, but you have no custom words to export in the selected language set.

Sorry, but in an attempt to open, read, or write to a file, wtcBB failed. Most commonly, this is due to insufficient privileges on *nix systems. Please make sure that you have chmodded the files/directories in question to either 755 or 777.

Sorry, but you have specified that you want all users to have unique email addresses. If you want to use this email address for the user you are adding, you will need to either change the user's email address that is already using it, or disable the option.
Sorry, but you must specify a unique usergroup title. wtcBB has detected that there is already a usergroup that exists with the specified title.
Sorry, but you cannot delete a default usergroup, as they are required for wtcBB to run properly.
Sorry, but there are no administrators added... So umm... How can you see this!?!?
Sorry, but you must specify a unique name/title.
Sorry, but you have entered an invalid password.
Sorry, but the user account you are attempting to use has insufficient privileges for the action you are trying to perform.

Sorry, but your administrative account has been restricted from performing this action.

In order to unrestrict access to this action, you'll need to ask your head administrator to do so. If you are the head administrator, you can edit the config.php file found in the includes directory. Add your userid to the "$superAdministrators" variable, and separate any additional userids by a comma. After you have done that, expand the "Usergroups" menu, and click on "Admin Permissions". You will then be able to edit administrative permissions for your administrators.
Sorry, but this user is "Uneditable". If you wish to edit this user, you will need to modify the $uneditableUsers variable in the includes/config.php file.
Sorry, but this usergroup contains an "Uneditable" user. If you wish to edit this usergroup, you will need to modify the $uneditableUsers variable in the includes/config.php file.
Sorry, but the requested file name does not exist.
Sorry, but there are currently no wtcBB Crons in the database.
Sorry, but our records show that this user has already been banned.
There are currently no banned users. You have a great community!
Sorry, but you are attempting to make this a child of one of its current childs. You cannot do this.
You must select at least one forum for this moderator to gain moderator privileges for.
Sorry, but you cannot delete the last forum. At least one forum is required to exist for wtcBB to run properly.
Sorry, but you must at least select one usergroup and one forum to apply these permissions to.
Sorry, but forum permissions for the selected usergroup and forum already exist.
Sorry, but you must provide a title to continue.
You must specify valid dates in order to continue.

Sorry, but you cannot have more than one of the same extension. You can associate multiple mime types with a single extension by following the directions found in the description of the "Mime Type" field.
Sorry, but the medium you have selected is already in effect.
Sorry, but you must provide at least an FAQ entry title for each language.
Sorry, but the language words for this FAQ entry have been deleted externally. You will need to delete and re-create this FAQ entry.
Sorry, but you cannot delete the FAQ Root entry. If you do not want the FAQ page to show on your message board, then you can disable it in the "Setup" section of "wtcBB Options".
Sorry, but you are required to upload an image.
Sorry, but you are required to enter a path to a directory. You either entered a path to a file, or a location that doesn't exist.
Sorry, but this group cannot be deleted, as it is required for the message board to function correctly.
Sorry, but you must select at least one usergroup.
Sorry, but you cannot delete the last style. At least one style is required to exist for wtcBB to run properly.
Sorry, but wtcBB requires this group to preserve the functionality of the bulletin board.
Sorry, but you must provide a name in order to continue.
Sorry, but since you did not select a field type of "text" or "textarea", you must provide at least one option in order to continue.
Sorry, but the specified hash or postid is invalid. Please try again.
Sorry, but you can't upload any more attachments as you have reached the per post limit.
Sorry, but the forum you are trying to access does not exist.
Sorry, but you can't restore a post that isn't deleted.
Sorry, but the thread you are trying to restore isn't deleted.
Sorry, but you cannont perform the requested action because this thread is deleted.
Sorry, but you cannot perform the requested action because the post is deleted.
Sorry, but you cannot move/copy a thread to a category.
Sorry, but you cannot merge a thread into itself.
Sorry, but there is already a poll in existance for this thread. If you are a moderator and have privleges, you can edit an existing poll or delete it.
Sorry, but you have voted for an invalid option.
Sorry, but you must enter a title for your poll.
Sorry, but you must specify at least one poll option.
Sorry, but there are no new posts.
Sorry, but you must fill in your username and password in order complete the login process.
Sorry, but you are not logged in and thusly cannot log out.
Sorry, but the administrator has specified that you need cookies in order to login.
Sorry, but you are under the minimum character count of:
Sorry, but you are over the maximum character count of:
Sorry, but you are over the maximum image amount of:
Sorry, but your title/subject is over the maximum character amount of:
Sorry, but your title is under the minimum character amount of:
Sorry, but you must have at least one character in your title/subject and your message.
Sorry, but as a guest you must supply a unique user name. You cannot use a user name that has already been registered by someone.
Sorry, but you did not specify a user to send an email to.
Sorry, but you must specify a message to send to a recipient.
Sorry, but your username is under the required minimum length.
Sorry, but your username is over the maximum amount of characters.
Sorry, but the username you entered does not match any account on file.
Sorry, but in order to report a post, you must first give a reason as to why you are reporting the post.
You do not have access to view this page. You are currently logged out, and your problem could be resolved by either logging in or registering a new account.

You do not have access to view this page. It could be due to many things:
  1. You do not have the privileges to access this page. You could be trying to perform an administrative action, or trying to edit someone else's post.
  2. The administrator could have disabled your account, or your account may be awaiting activation.

This is the username you use to access your database. If you are not sure of this, please contact your host.

This is the prefix that will be used to create the tables in your database. This is useful if you want more than one instance of wtcBB in one database, or if you want wtcBB in the same database as another application. Otherwise, you can leave this blank.

This is the prefix that will be appened to the beginning of all cookie names set by wtcBB. This is useful if you are running more than one instance of wtcBB on a domain. Otherwise you can leave this as "wtcBB_".
This is the type of database you will be using. The best option is selected for you.

Folders are a way to organize your conversations. Folders act strictly as an organizational means, and allow you to classify your messages. You may also use them to mass-delete all messages (in a particular folder by deleting the folder).

Registration is free, and you do so under your own free will. In order to proceed with the registration and keep a membership, you must agree that you have acknowledged these forum rules.

The forum Administrators and Moderators try to keep this forum clean, however they cannot moderate everything. The adminstrators, owners, developers of wtcBB, and moderators of this bulletin board are not responsible for the content of any message posted here. Only the author of a respecting post is responsible for its contents. Therefore, only the author of a message can be held accountable for the content of that message. Owners, administrators, or moderators have the right to remove, edit, add, or alter anyone's account or messages for any reason they deem necessary.

This thread is currently deleted. This means that posts cannot be added, edited or deleted. Nor can this thread be moved, closed, opened, split, etc. When a thread is deleted, it is locked in its current state. The thread must be restored before any changes can be made.
Go to this user's home page
Please select the forum you wish to move or copy this thread to.

You can enter the link to the thread you wish to merge into this one. When you merge the thread you specify here, it will be deleted and all of its posts will be inserted chronologically into the current thread.
This is the number of days that this poll will remain open after it is created. If 0 is used, the poll will be perpetual.
This is the title of the new thread created.

You can perform a moderator action on the old thread by specifying it here. The "new" thread is the thread created with the selected posts below, and the "old" thread is the thread where the posts below originated from.

Splitting a thread consists of popping out posts from a current thread in the database and creating a new thread with the posts selected. This is ideal for threads that reach a very high post count, or if two different discussions are going on at the same time. Simply select the posts below from which you want to make your new post with, and configure any options above.
You can specify a URL location to your avatar of choice (beginning with "http://"). This avatar will be treated like one that is uploaded, and the same restrictions will be applied.
If the avatar you want to use isn't already on the internet, you may upload an image from your computer to use as an avatar.

In order to change your email address, you must activate it by responding to an automatic email sent to your current email address. If it is not activated in 24 hours or less, you must fill out this form again. No information will be changed until you activate the new email address.

In order to change your password, you must activate it by responding to an automatic email sent to your email address. If it is not activated in 24 hours or less, you must fill out this form again. No information will be changed until you activate the new password. You are also required to provide your current password.
If this is enabled, you will be able to use a toolbar that will automatically insert text/image formatting codes for you.
If you are invisible, other users will not be able to see that you are browsing the forums.
If this is enabled, other members will be able to contact you by email through the message board.
If this is disabled, any emails that an administrator sends will not be sent to you.
If this is disabled, users will not be able to send you personal messages through the bulletin board. You will still be able to send messages, however.
If this is enabled, you will receive an email notification whenever someone sends you a new personal message.
If this is enabled, you will be alerted of any new personal messages upon visiting the message board.
This title will appear below your username when posting.
